type.name: characterized_class_of_physical_object
type.description: A characterized_class_of_physical_object is a Class_of_activity or a Class_of_product.

description.p: A Class_of_possession_of_property is possession of property mapping between a Class_of_activity or a Class_of_product and a Physical_quantity_space.
The nature of a Possession_of_property for individual activities or products can be specified by indicating a class_of_possession_of_property of which it is a member.
The nature of a Property_condition for classes of activity or product can be specified by indicating a class_of_possession_of_property of which it is a member.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_space that is mass; and

example.p: that indicates a vessel possesses the mass when empty, is a Class_of_possession_of_property.

description.note: The entity Class_of_possession_of_property defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity indirect_property defined in ISO 15926-2.

explicit.name: base_independent_property
explicit.description: an Physical_quantity_space that has a member possessed by each member of the described_element.

description.p: A Physical_quantity_range is type of Physical_quantity_space that is all the instances of Physical_quantity_value between an upper and a lower bound.
description.note: A Physical_quantity_value is often not known exactly. In this case, a Physical_quantity_range of which it is known to be a member can be specified.
The entity type Physical_quantity_range defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type property_range defined in ISO 15926-2.
description.example: Mass between 9.9 kg and 10.1 kg is a Physical_quantity_range.
Temperature between 400 degrees Celsius and 410 degrees Celsius is a Physical_quantity_range.

description.p: A Physical_quantity_space is type of Independent_property and Class that is a physical quantity space.

note.p: The entity type Physical_quantity_space defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type property_space defined in ISO 15926-2.

description.p: A Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry is a type of Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference that is defined within this part of ISO 10303.
The standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry specified by this part of ISO 10303 are shown in Table 1.

td.p: zero order tensor or scalar - see ISO 10303-104:2000
first order tensor or vector in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
first order tensor or vector in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
orientation in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
orientation in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000

description.p: These standard instances of class are identified using the methodology of IEC 61360, where:

ul.li: the code is as specified in Table 1;
the supplier is this part of ISO 10303 identified as 'ISO-TS-10303-1080'.

where.label: valid_standard_class
where.description: The supplier shall be 'ISO-TS-10303-1080', and the code shall be one of those listed in Table 1.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry is a type of Independent_property and Class that has instances of Physical_quantity_space as members and that indicates the tensor order and tensor symmetry of the members of the Physical_quantity_space.

note.p: Standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry are specified in Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry.

example.p: Symmetric second order tensor is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference is a type of Tensor_order_and_symmetry that is defined by reference to an external library.

note.p: Standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry are specified in Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry.

explicit.name: item_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the the Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference.

explicit.name: source_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the supplier of definition of the Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry_for_physical_quantity_space is a relationship between a Physical_quantity_space and a Tensor_order_and_symmetry that indicates the tensor order and symmetry for the members of the Physical_quantity_space.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_space that is thermal conductivity; and
the Tensor_order_and_symmetry that is symmetric second order tensor,

example.p: that indicates the nature of the physical quantity space, is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry_for_physical_quantity_space.

explicit.name: relating
explicit.description: the Tensor_order_and_symmetry that indicates the tensor order and symmetry.

explicit.name: related
explicit.description: a Physical_quantity_space that has the tensor order and symmetry.
